text: this is a DSC differential scanning
calorimetry which is made by EA what
you're doing here is looking at heat
flows so you put in a sample and a
reference man that sample then you can
analyze where the heat whether the heat
is flowing in or out of the sample how
much is needed either to melt or
recrystallize in various properties like
that and so this DSC allows you to load
in 50 samples ahead of time you can set
everything up from the computer and then
the control panel then runs each of
those samples and so very easily you can
run 50 samples run them over night
coming into the morning and then you can
kind of look at your dad and figure out
oh do you have a TG here or because
where is the melt temperature and things
like that so that's essentially what
this guy does gives you very accurate
information about crystallization melt
temperatures and things of the white
bread garlic I work for the Mackey group
at the University of Delaware
